titlestmt.titleproper: Finding Aid for the Herbert Wisbey, Jr. Papers
titlestmt.author: Elmira College

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid created with EADitor by user nelmc.
profiledesc.langusage: Finding aid is written in English

did.unittitle: Finding Aid for the Herbert Wisbey, Jr. Papers
did.abstract: The papers document Herb Wisbey’s tenure as the Director of the Center of Mark Twain Studies at Elmira College from its inception in 1983 to 1986. The collection contains research materials for many of his published articles, primarily for those published in the Mark Twain Society Bulletin. Correspondence, Mark Twain research materials and a research file of predominantly local figures represent the extent of the collection.

repository.corpname: Mark Twain Archive, Gannett-Tripp Library, Elmira College, Elmira, N.Y.

bioghist.p: Born in Boston, Massachusetts and raised in Rhode Island, Wisbey came to the Southern Tier Region of New York in 1952, taking a position as Head of the Department of History and Political Science at Keuka College. Dr. Herbert Wisbey received degrees from University of Rhode Island and the University of Arizona, earning a Ph.D from Columbia University in 1951. In 1962, Wisbey joined the faculty at Corning Community College and three years later he joined the faculty of Elmira College.

Dr. Wisbey served as Professor of American History and became the Archivist of Elmira College in 1974. He authored several books before co-writing Mark Twain in Elmira with Robert Jerome in 1977. In 1983, Wisbey became the first director of the Center for Mark Twain Studies following the gift of Quarry Farm by the Langdon family of Elmira. He retired from Elmira College in 1986, receiving Emeritus distinction.

scopecontent.p: The Herbert Wisbey Papers document the formative years of the Center for Mark Twain Studies containing the Quarry Farm Advisory Board meeting minutes, correspondence, research and information on Quarry Farm, the summer home of Mark Twain. These materials provide a superficial glance of the history, collections and administration of the Center for Mark Twain Studies at the time of its inception, documenting the years 1983 to 1986.

did.unittitle: Series 1: Center For Mark Twain Studies and Mark Twain Society Bulletin materials

note.p: This series has been arranged in alphabetical order by folder title and contains materials associated with Herb Wisbey’s tenure as director of the Center for Mark Twain Studies. Materials related to the Mark Twain Society Bulletin are also included.

This series has been arranged in alphabetical order by folder title and contains materials associated with Herb Wisbey’s tenure as director of the Center for Mark Twain Studies. Materials related to the Mark Twain Society Bulletin are also included.

did.unittitle: Advisory Board - Reports of the Quarry Farm Advisory Board and Director; National Trust for Historic Preservation documents
Advisory Board -- Board minutes, annual reports, memos, correspondence; including Center for Mark Twain Studies events and promotional materials
Copper Plate -- Mark Twain's 67th Birthday etching, correspondence concerning the item in the Mark Twain Archive
Correspondence -- Materials concerning the Center for Mark Twain Studies during Wisbey's tenure as director
Cotton, Michelle -- Independent Study, "Mark Twain's Elmira" manuscript
Harnsberger, Caroline -- "Mark Twain, Craftsman" manuscript
Karanovich, Nick -- Correspondence, includes discussion of the Pond photographs donated to Elmira College from Nick Karanovich
Lectures on Mark Twain -- Outlines and notes for lectures
Mark Twain in Elmira -- Clippings, publication by Jervis Langdon, miscellaneous materials
Mark Twain in Elmira -- Reviews, clippings and photographs of Wisbey and Jerome
Mark Twain Foundation -- Proposals, correspondence
Mark Twain Papers -- Correspondence and research materials primarily concerning Mark Twain Letters
Mark Twain Papers -- Primarily correspondence concerning research
Mark Twain Society -- By-Laws, minutes, clippings, promotional materials
Mark Twain Society Bulletin -- Article manuscripts, research materials, correspondence
Mark Twain Society Bulletin -- Mal Marsden article not used, "Mark Twain and the Face of the Land" manuscript
Mark Twain Society Bulletin, July 1996 -- Manuscripts and materials for publication
Mark Twain Society Bulletin, Jan 1997 -- Manuscripts and materials for publication
Mark Twain Society Bulletin, July 1997 -- Manuscripts and materials for publication
National Register of Historic Places -- Elmira College Old Campus and Mark Twain Study correspondence and nomination form
News clippings -- Mark Twain related
Proposal -- Biographical Twain series proposal by Sandra Bradley
Quarry Farm -- Clippings found in books, includes correspondence and photocopies of clippings
Quarry Farm: Fireplace Tiles -- Research and manuscript by Barbara Taylor, includes notes
Quarry Farm: History and Architecture -- Research materials, floor plans, correspondence, clippings
Quarry Farm: Marginalia and miscellaneous materials from Quarry Farm -- Primarily photocopied letters, no materials concerning Mark Twain
Reviews: Mary Boewe review of "Mark Twain in the Company of Women" by Laura Skandera Trombley -- Includes correspondence with Wisbey

Siena College Conference -- Includes correspondence, program and clipping; Jeffrey Steinbrink article, Mark Twain on the Mountaintop: The Elmira Connection; Richard Veler article, "Mark Twain: A Not-So-Innocent Abroad
Wharton, William -- Poems written at Quarry Farm from a visit in 1983, includes clipping about the author and poet
Series 2: Correspondence

note.p: The bulk of this series includes collegial letters concerning research, publication and solicitation for reviews and articles for the Mark Twain Society Bulletin. The bulk of the letters are routine letters of transmittal and do not provide an in-depth look at scholarship or Wisbey’s personal or collegial relationships. This Series is arranged alphabetically by author’s last name or organizational name.

Series 3: Mark Twain research materials

note.p: This series is arranged alphabetically by folder title and is primarily comprised of notes and photocopied research materials. There are a number of miscellaneous folders are at the end of the series.

Miscellaneous (6) -- Primarily Mark Twain promotional materials for Mark Twain events, includes photocopied research materials
Series 4: Research Files

note.p: This series is primarily comprised of research on Elmira persons with a Twain connection. The series is arranged alphabetically by author or subject.
